alert.note: Alert for Shawano (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 12 at 10:46PM CST until January 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A SIGNIFICANT WINTER STORM CONTINUES TO IMPACT THE REGION WITH HEAVY SNOW AND STRONG WINDS THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... .A strengthening low pressure system will track from southern Lake Michigan to Lake Huron by Saturday morning. The strong system will bring heavy snow and strong winds to the region. Most of the region should see total snowfall accumulations between 6 to 20 inches of snow, with the highest amounts across the Door Peninsula. In addition, wind gusts will continue to gust to 45 mph in the Fox Valley, lakeshore, and the bayshore where blizzard conditions are expected into Saturday morning. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SATURDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Additional snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph will lead to considerable blowing and drifting. * WHERE...Shawano County. * WHEN...Until noon CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
